title: Welcome to the Documentation
content:
# Welcome! üéâ

Welcome to this modern documentation system! This platform is designed to provide a beautiful, user-friendly experience for both readers and content creators.

## What Makes This Special?

This documentation system combines the best of modern web development:

- **Beautiful Design**: Inspired by GitBook with extensive theming options
- **Easy to Use**: Intuitive admin panel for managing content
- **Powerful Features**: Search, sharing, syntax highlighting, and more
- **No Database**: All content stored in simple JSON files
- **Fully Responsive**: Works perfectly on any device

## Quick Start

1. **Browse Articles**: Use the sidebar to navigate through categories and articles
2. **Search**: Press `Ctrl+K` or click the search icon to find anything
3. **Change Theme**: Click the palette icon to try different themes
4. **Share**: Click the share button to get a permalink to any article

## For Administrators

If you're managing this documentation:

1. Visit the [admin panel](/admin/)
2. Log in with your credentials (default: `password`)
3. Start creating categories and articles
4. Customize settings to match your brand

> **Tip**: Change the default password in the Settings tab!

## Need Help?

Check out the other articles in this documentation for detailed guides and feature explanations.

Happy documenting! üìö

title: Markdown Syntax Guide
content:
# Markdown Syntax Guide

This system uses Markdown for formatting articles. Here's a comprehensive guide to the syntax.

## Headings

Use `#` symbols for headings:

```markdown
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3
#### Heading 4
```

## Text Formatting

**Bold text** using `**bold**` or `__bold__`

*Italic text* using `*italic*` or `_italic_`

***Bold and italic*** using `***text***`

~~Strikethrough~~ using `~~text~~`

## Lists

### Unordered Lists

- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item
  - Another nested item
- Item 3

### Ordered Lists

1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

## Links and Images

[Link text](https://example.com)

![Alt text](image-url.jpg)

## Code

### Inline Code

Use backticks for `inline code`.

### Code Blocks

```javascript
function greet(name) {
    console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`);
}

greet('World');
```

```python
def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

greet("World")
```

```php
<?php
function greet($name) {
    echo "Hello, $name!";
}

greet('World');
?>
```

## Blockquotes

> This is a blockquote.
> It can span multiple lines.
>
> ‚Äî Citation

## Tables

| Feature | Description | Status |
|---------|-------------|--------|
| Themes | Multiple color schemes | ‚úÖ Active |
| Search | Full-text search | ‚úÖ Active |
| Share | Permalink sharing | ‚úÖ Active |

## Horizontal Rule

---

Use three or more hyphens, asterisks, or underscores.

## Best Practices

1. Use headings to structure your content
2. Keep paragraphs concise
3. Use code blocks for technical content
4. Add alt text to images for accessibility
5. Use tables for structured data

Now you're ready to create amazing documentation! üöÄ

title: Theme System
content:
# Theme System üé®

One of the standout features of this documentation system is its extensive theme support. Choose from 8 carefully crafted themes to match your preference or brand.

## Available Themes

### 1. Dark Theme
The default theme with a modern dark color scheme. Perfect for reducing eye strain during extended reading sessions.

### 2. Light Theme
A clean, bright theme for those who prefer reading on a light background.

### 3. Ocean Theme
Deep blue tones inspired by the ocean. Calming and professional.

### 4. Forest Theme
Natural green colors that evoke the tranquility of a forest.

### 5. Sunset Theme
Warm oranges and purples reminiscent of a beautiful sunset.

### 6. Neon Theme
Vibrant cyberpunk-inspired colors with electric blues and magentas.

### 7. Midnight Theme
Deep indigo tones perfect for late-night reading.

### 8. Spring Theme
Soft pastel colors that bring the freshness of spring.

## How to Switch Themes

1. Click the **palette icon** (üé®) in the header
2. Select your preferred theme from the dropdown
3. The theme will apply instantly and be saved in your browser

## Theme Persistence

Your theme preference is automatically saved in your browser's local storage, so it persists across sessions.

## For Developers

Themes are implemented using CSS custom properties (variables). Each theme defines its own color palette:

```css
[data-theme="dark"] {
    --bg-primary: #0f172a;
    --accent-primary: #3b82f6;
    /* ... more variables */
}
```

You can easily add new themes by defining a new set of CSS variables in `assets/css/style.css`.

## Accessibility

All themes are designed with accessibility in mind, ensuring adequate contrast ratios for readability.

Enjoy customizing your reading experience! ‚ú®

title: Search Functionality
content:
# Search Functionality üîç

The built-in search feature helps you quickly find content across all articles.

## How to Search

There are two ways to open the search:

1. Click the **search icon** (üîç) in the header
2. Press **`Ctrl+K`** (or `Cmd+K` on Mac) - the universal search shortcut

## Search Features

### Real-time Search
As you type, results appear instantly with no delay. The search is performed locally in your browser for maximum speed.

### Highlighted Results
Search terms are highlighted in both:
- Article titles
- Content excerpts

This makes it easy to see why an article matched your search.

### Context Snippets
Each result shows a snippet of text surrounding your search term, giving you context before clicking.

### Smart Matching
The search is case-insensitive and matches partial words, making it easy to find what you're looking for.

## Search Tips

1. **Be specific**: Use specific terms for better results
2. **Try variations**: If you don't find what you need, try synonyms
3. **Use keyboard**: Navigate results with arrow keys and Enter

## For Administrators

The search indexes all article titles and content automatically. No configuration needed - it just works!

## Technical Details

- **Client-side search**: All searching happens in the browser
- **No server required**: Fast and efficient
- **Privacy-friendly**: No search queries sent to external servers

Happy searching! üéØ

title: Admin Panel Guide
content:
# Admin Panel Guide üõ†Ô∏è

The admin panel is your control center for managing documentation content.

## Accessing the Admin Panel

1. Navigate to `/admin/` on your site
2. Enter your admin password (default: `password`)
3. Click "Login"

**Important**: Change the default password immediately!

## Dashboard

The dashboard provides an overview of your documentation:

- **Total Articles**: Number of articles created
- **Categories**: Number of categories
- **Recent**: Articles created in the last 7 days
- **Published**: Number of published articles

### Quick Actions

Use the quick action buttons to:
- Create a new article
- Add a category

## Managing Articles

### Creating an Article

1. Go to the **Articles** tab
2. Click **"New Article"**
3. Fill in:
   - **Title**: The article's title
   - **Category**: Select from existing categories
   - **Content**: Write in Markdown format
4. Click **"Save Article"**

### Editing an Article

1. Find the article in the list
2. Click the **edit icon** (pencil)
3. Make your changes
4. Click **"Save Article"**

### Deleting an Article

1. Click the **delete icon** (trash)
2. Confirm the deletion

## Managing Categories

Categories help organize your articles.

### Creating a Category

1. Go to the **Categories** tab
2. Click **"New Category"**
3. Enter:
   - **Name**: Category name
   - **Description**: Optional description
4. Click **"Save Category"**

### Editing/Deleting Categories

Same as articles - use the edit and delete icons.

**Note**: Deleting a category makes its articles uncategorized.

## Settings

Customize your documentation site:

### Site Name
The name displayed in the header and browser title.

### Site Description
A brief description of your documentation.

### Admin Password
Change your admin password for security.

1. Enter a new password
2. Click **"Save Settings"**
3. Use the new password next time you log in

## Tips for Success

1. **Organize with categories**: Group related articles
2. **Use descriptive titles**: Make articles easy to find
3. **Write in Markdown**: Take advantage of formatting
4. **Regular backups**: Backup your `data` folder regularly
5. **Keep it updated**: Review and update articles periodically

## Security Best Practices

1. **Change default password** immediately
2. **Use a strong password** with mixed characters
3. **Logout when done** editing
4. **Limit admin access** to trusted users
5. **Regular backups** of the data directory

Happy documenting! üìù
